body: It's fixed now.. thank you! I haven't touched for quite some time but now it's up to date...
Thank you very nice..!! :)
To achieve that.. I would simply include the Bootstrap stuff in one `.less` file and probably call it `no-bootstrap-social.less`.. is that ok?
Thanks
Thanks!

Other than having the `master` branch am I missing anything else in the bower.json file?

https://github.com/lipis/bootstrap-social/blob/gh-pages/bower.json
Ok, it seems legit, specially when gh-pages are default branch and will stay that way forever;

Yes that was my plan to have only one branch...

So you're telling me that I don't have to do anything else regarding that issue?! Can I skip the creation of the master branch..? I just tried to install it and it worked normally with the latest 4.0.5 version..
then it's fine; sorry for bothering;
I never used SCSS in real world but of course I don't mind including that as well.. It's not like this project will change dramatically until the version 4.0 or something.. So yeah! Bring it..
Perfect.. thanks man!
I think I'll drop this one.. it doesn't make much sense to copy all the dependencies for the buttons from bootstrap just to make it Bootstrapless, something that is called bootstrap-social :)
Can you create a JSFiddle or something with the problem?! I really hate !important and I'm wondering why is that needed..
You might be importing your custom css file before bootstrap. Make sure you have it last on the list.

http://jsfiddle.net/DrewCPU/xm5Dr/ has everything loaded and you can see the issue.  I find that adding !important to the padding on .btn-social, the white color attributes, and the hover background colors fixed the problem for me.  I also moved the color attribute up to .btn-social instead of leaving it for every social network on my site (http://www.mywebwishlist.com).

In order to fix this problem few `!important` here and there will just make it more complicated because Bootstrap has many rules that are applied to the `<a>` of the `navbar`.

I would suggest you to change the links to `<button>` and handle them using JS.. by doing that you just need to adjust the width/height of the icon to match the Flatly theme because you're not using the .less files..

Check this example here.. and notice that I have very few changes:
http://jsfiddle.net/xm5Dr/6/

![screen shot 2014-01-21 at 18 50 51](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/125676/1966180/ac34ca3c-82c4-11e3-8e0a-2348ba8bbbb8.png)
Just in case you want to avoid using JavaScript for the ` ``` The above code is more or less similar to the ``` ```
That'll work for me.  Thanks for all your work on these buttons.

Something like that: http://jsfiddle.net/aHs8J/1/ (resize to bigger screen to see them aligned..)

If you don't want to collapse into stack change the divs to `col-xs-*` and they will always going to be aligned..
That's the idea at least of course you can have your own divs and justify them as you like.. I'm just showing the fact that the buttons are quite flexible and support these kind of things..
@samdunne Does the above solves your problem? Otherwise you'll have to be more specific on what you want..

Here you go http://www.jsdelivr.com/#!bootstrap.social

You can even build a URL with all dependencies and load it with a single HTTP request. 
For example: `http://cdn.jsdelivr.net/g/bootstrap@3.1(css/bootstrap.min.css),bootstrap.social`

So can we keep it as the original name?! :dancer:

Per your request I renamed the project. Old files will still remain on the origin so if someone is using the current name his website wont break.

I think is better to use `#2672ec` since it can be found in the official Microsoft accounts login page.. 
So if you could please make that change and also instead of `btn-windows` say it `btn-microsoft` (because it's a microsoft account and not windows) and finally put them all in alphabetical order :)

I updated the color of the Live/Windows icon and renamed it to windows -- it was called 'windows' because that's the name of the fa icon, and chose it for consistency's sake.    I guess technically it's a "Windows Live" login :-)  As far as the colors for the OpenID icon, since FA doesn't do multi-color, the choice according to the OpenID style guide is white-on-black.  opinion?

Recently they changed it to [Microsoft Account](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_account) so that's why I also want to start using that instead of Windows.. which makes more sense if you get from the rest of the brands when trying to login with their accounts.. If it was still hotmail, that would be another story but they want to unify all these accounts into one and I think they made the right decision for the name..! Having said that I think FA should have an alias for `fa-microsoft` :)

As for the OpenID.. it looks like the guides are saying either black on white or white on black... but I still think it would be still ok with their normal color..! As with this project I also want to have the collection of their official colors...
But I didn't think about the consistency because it's `fa-windows`... I'll think about it and merge them tomorrow.. thanks for the PR..
Do you mind updating the [bootstrap-social.scss](https://github.com/lipis/bootstrap-social/blob/gh-pages/bootstrap-social.scss) for consistency reasons as well?!

Well none of these properties are actually used in Bootstrap 3 as you can see here: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/v3.2.0/less/buttons.less nor in this project.. so I don't see any point of actually including these properties..
My bad. I was using a modified bootstrap.

@chester1000 My main reason is because it's super easy to add any new button you want if you are using Less or SCSS.. If you are not using any of those.. you probably should.. but that's another story.

The second reason is where should I stop?! How many buttons should I possibly add into that project?!

I could maybe add as many as possible (until we'll run out of FA icons, but maybe then add other icon vendors) but then it's going to be too much deleting for people that only want a few.. :)

On the other hand.. with this project I also wanted to make sure that all the colors that are used.. are as official as possible :) So maybe that's a good reason to just add more buttons to have it at least as a reference for the colors.. but I just realised that there is this website: http://brandcolors.net/

So I'm not sure :) What do you think? Should I just continue adding more and more buttons?! Is it really needed?

**tl;dr: IMO the more buttons the better.**

@lipis Your rules are a great reason to add as many buttons as possible ;). I agree it's easy to **_write_** new button definitions, but first you need to check if icon exists in `fa` or `glyphicon`, decide on a proper bkg and font color, etc...  agreed it's not **super** hard to do that, but still it will be great to have one repository of standardized, scalable, good quality and consistent social buttons.

I wouldn't worry too much about adding unnecessary bytes to styles, because:
- the more buttons there is the more of them will overlap, so instead of two definitions there will be one definition with two class names,
- even with hundreds of buttons size of this library will be negligible,
- there's plenty of tools that strip unnecessary styles for production.

> even with hundreds of buttons size of this library will be negligible

Not exactly, as every new button adds a bit less than 1KB to the minified CSS, it won't be exactly negligible..

But maybe after all I'll start adding more just to have them as references.. haven't make up my mind yet.. and it's a bit late here :) Will think about it.. maybe I'll add one file that has only the top 3 vendors and all of them in the rest.. :)
The colors should be changed only when Font Awesome will be updated, mixing new colors with old icons would be not nice.

Could you update the color, please?

To make things even more correct, there should be a version (e.g. 4.6.2) that depends on Font Awesome `>=4.0.0 <4.2.0` and has the old color, and a new version (e.g. 4.7.0) that denends on Font Awesome `>=4.2.0` and has the new color.

@snovity can you post the changes you did? Thx
@edbond I made a pull request with my changes

FWIW, I've gotten several emails from users who were confused and frustrated that they couldn't log in to my site. It took some digging to learn this was the issue.

I've tested locally and confirmed that simply changing the class name to something other than btn-facebook prevents the blocking. Something like btn-soc-facebook successfully bypasses the block, and seems reasonable in the scope of this project (adds a layer of namespacing, which might be a good thing anyway).

The /intent/ of fanboy-social, as I understand, is to block the fancy embedded share buttons that track you as you move around the web, /even when you don't click them/. I say that based on this post:
https://adblockplus.org/blog/about-that-facebook-tracking-thing

So I think making this adjustment is /not/ just playing a game of cat and mouse. I don't think the author(s) of fanboy-social would feel it necessary to adjust their list to block bootstrap-social buttons--I think they were blocked unintentionally. Therefore I claim this classname change would be purely a bugfix.

I understand project maintainers might disagree with this claim though, and a class name change kinda breaks backwards compatibility. But if project maintainers agree with me, I'm happy to write a PR. Let me know.

Spoke too soon...the fix I'm proposing almost works, but the fontawesome icons still get blocked.

The fact this filter blocks fa- classes is ... ugh. Perhaps they /do/ intend to block /all/ buttons /in any way related/ to social. I know /my/ users who have installed this are disappointed with the behavior though. At least some of them. Ugh.

Considering merging fa into my codebase and also tweaking their classnames...That probably isn't really a viable solution for this library as a whole though. So now I'm thinking this bug is a WONTFIX :/

Relevant thread on the fontawesome project:
https://github.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/issues/1799

I already send an email to the owner of it.. of course there are no bad feelings or anything :) I'm actually flattered with those things.. :dancer:
I'm the owner now https://www.npmjs.com/package/bootstrap-social :+1: so the next question is how do I update it?

:tada: 

https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/creating-node-modules + https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/publishing-npm-packages should be more than enough!

For the `package.json`, you can always take great inspiration from your `bower.json`. You can even keep the same dependencies as they exist on npm as well:

``` js
"dependencies": {
  "bootstrap": "~3",
  "font-awesome": "~4.3"
}
```

Don't hesitate if you have questions or if you would rather I submit this as part of a PR. Thanks!
actually if you could submit a PR would be the best ATM :) Try to keep it as close to `bower.json` so it will be easier to maintain it later on..

bong.. I will in the near future break up the source files to core and the rest and I will start adding more icons.. but in reality the only thing that you need to do in order to use it in your own project is to find the right color and then:

``` less
.btn-youtube       { .btn-social(#c0ffee); }
```

or

``` sass
.btn-youtube        { @include btn-social(#c0ffee); }
```

Why was this closed without a fix?
I've sent a PR with a fix.
See https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#main for reference. `main` can only be a JavaScript file.
It looks like you are right :) Thanks man..
`css` or maybe put it in `files` instead.. where we could include all the source files?

`files` is not necessary, since NPM includes all files except for `node_modules`, or `.gitignore`. You don't actually need any field, but I saw some CSS packages using `css` (either bootstrap or awesome-font). It's not standardized though.

*Update:* Bootstrap 4 Beta's `button-variant` mixin has changed per <https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/commit/597e9f861807868d8d13bac93e8a328493fe6d54#diff-edb9cd89b66120ef946a81de31f6bb06R6>.

You need to modify bootstrap-social to use a different approach.  Bootstrap 4 Beta has a mixin called `color-yiq` that automatically calculates the best font color for a button depending the background-color, so we don't need to explicitly pass a font color.

You can use my fork if interested until my pull request for BS 4 support at <https://github.com/lipis/bootstrap-social/pull/162> is accepted and released:

```sh
npm install niftylettuce/bootstrap-social#gh-pages
```

or if you're using yarn:

```sh
yarn add niftylettuce/bootstrap-social#gh-pages
```

I've opened a pull request for adding Bootstrap 4 support.

@naterexw please see bootstrap 4 alpha - your usage of button-variant is now outdated, see my comment here https://github.com/lipis/bootstrap-social/issues/123#issuecomment-330131175.  also this is a non-standard approach - you should have fixed the source directly (e.g. not create a new file)?
